comment: The strength and conditioning coaching course can be really difficult for students who haven't had any anatomy courses. The class is very fast paced in the beginning but slows down for the last 2 exams. There is a big project at the end of the semester so make sure to come to class to learn everything you need to know for it.

Dr. Hales was by far one of the hardest/worst professor I had His lectures are fill in the blank so you have to be there. His exam are hard, he won't tell you exactly what to study, just says study everything and then the exam  doesn't contain anything we went over in class. I say try to study a lot because he isn't much help when you ask for help.
Tests are all in person. Powerpoints have alot of slides. Tests are worth 20% of grade. Quizzes are not worth much.
Tests are all face to face.

Such a good professor! Really cares about students doing well. Tests are only on materials provided in the powerpoints so it's important to go to class to get the info bc powerpoints are fill in the blank style. I went to every class and then just reviewed the powerpoint the morning of the test and I got A's on every test. Definitely recommend!

If more students from his recent semesters rated him his rating would go down. When asking for help he laughed during and said "I don't know how else to say it anatomy is hard". I asked to see my results from a test we took and he said it is not fair to other students if I see it, but I can come next semester. Make sure to study b/c he won't help.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This professor was not an understanding one at all! considering we were in a pandemic mid semester he was not understanding of the situation students faced, he did not work well with us and gave absolutely NO leniency regardless of our situation. I would study the textbook and powerpoint page for page and still failed the exams. extremely stressful
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Great course and great professor! He is a straight-to-the-point kinda guy. If you ask him what to study, he will reply "everything." He wants you to understand the course, in class but will not give you the answers. His exams come from the power points, highly recommend studying those.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: HPE 2250: Worst teacher ever. He just reads over PowerPoints, does not tell you what is expected to be on the exam, just tells you to review the PPs. If you ask him what is expected on the exam he will say he does not know. Does not know how to teach and does not care for students. Attendance is not mandatory,but not worth coming to anyways.

Dr. Hales is really kind and helpful for learning. The lab activities are helpful and informative, but the tests are difficult. The lectures and notes are helpful, but the topics are hard to understand. The textbook goes more in detail than the lectures. The final project is graded leniently, and gives you the opportunity to design your own program

Professor Hales is one of the most unorganized people I've met. He gives no direction on the final project and can't justify where he comes up with his grades for each test or assignment. Be sure to check your exams for his incorrect grading, because that tends to happen. He is also unprofessional/rude in the way he speaks to students.

I recommend him! His tests are hard, but they count for basically nothing. The labs count the most. If you show up to class to do all of the labs and activities, it's pretty difficult to get lower than an A in the class.

He's a really nice teacher, but he's just very unorganized disorganized. We missed two weeks of class due to snow, but he still made the class very unorganized. Study guides don't help to much and tests are kinda hard.

Mr. Hales is very laid back and very knowledgeable. Show up for class, review ppts, & book and you'll be fine. Gives bonus ? on exams so pay attn and be able to write more than one sentence! Agree with other commenter- the rudeness of talkers & Facebookers are so disrespectful. Pay attn bc it can be an easy F as well. Definitely recommend.
No direction on the project, but overall a interesting class.

HPS is an inherently boring class to many people but Dr.Hales makes it fun! He's not a hard teacher, and very approachable and helpful. Some of the freshmen in his class should learn some respect though and not talk while he's talking.

An amazing teacher. Knows what he is doing, and his lectures are easy to understand. Only problem is that he had a hard time sticking to the schedule, but it was the first time the class was being done during the summer. He will tell you you how things we once believed were true are actually false, and can prove it. Overall, a GREAT professor.

Easy class, much easier than other HPS teachers. Hales does not know how to use D2L or the textbook's website. He was unclear and unorganized with due dates. I still got a good grade in the course, and it is easy, but it was frustrating not knowing what was going on with due dates. I'd take him, but be prepared for disorganization. Easy B.

His class was okay. He relies heavily on the textbook for his tests, and some of the information isn't on the powerpoints, but most of it was. All of the assignments are easy A's. Just look over the text before a test and you'll do fine in his class. The material isn't difficult, the class is just very dull.
He is easy but very rude and not helpful. Doesnt return emails and will make it hard for you to make up a test.

This was the easiest class I ever taken. If you read his PPT's the day of the test you will be fine. But! He is so irresponsible. He went less classes than most of the students. He even missed test day, and came back with a tan... Just another professor  taking an easy paycheck

This was a really easy class. He doesn't really make you work out any more than you want to and I really appreciated that! He has one project, three tests and a couple labs from the book. I got an A in this class without ever making an A on the tests so it's pretty well balanced! He is an ass to those who smart off to him but he is nice to the rest

One of the worst "teachers". In quotes because he is a MD but a bad teacher. Textbook example of someone taking a teaching job for the paycheck. You will not do good on any tests. He chooses between his own notes, his PPT's and the text book. Very difficult to maintain a good grade in this class.

He breaks his class into: 60% tests, 15% HW, 25% project. This wouldn't be much of a problem, but he takes at least a week and 1/2 to grade a test, and much longer to grade HW. But even then, not so bad. The project however, uses his software... and he doesn't make it easy to understand.
He is easy but he is an ASS! Smart mouth and a little rude, He is boring and so annoying. Take him for the A but know he is so RUDE.
Great Prof! We didnt really do a whole lot. He made us think the final was gonna be real hard but it was SO easy!

He is a great teacher and you learn alot from this class. It is alot of work but if you do all of it including the extra credit and show up to class and listen you can do fine. He is crystal clear. An easy A if you make an effort.

I never wanted to take this class, but at least he didn't make us work out.  But, we did have to learn all those stupid ladder drills.  No, he won't make you do them for the final, but you need to be able to identify them on screen and write them down.  Make sure to email him your project so he can tell you what to do - EASY 'A' if you do that!!!!
I dropped because I couldn't understand anything he was saying.  I hated his PowerPoints - they made NO sense.  I retook it with McLester with MUCH better results.

Very nice and easy going professor.  Recommened for HPS.  All powerpoints available online.  Physical activity required in every class but what you do is up to you.  Test are multiple choice, labs are are required.  Multiplt extra credits available.
Good teacher.   Puts all lectures up on powerpoint.  Test are very specific.  Final is a general test.  Must come to class to get participation points.

Dr. Hales is a great teacher and a great guy.  MAKE SURE YOU GO TO CLASS for participation points.  I didn't go to class and it dropped my grade a whole letter grade even though I did great on tests and labs.  But I still recommend it but you must go to class.
the class isnt that fun, but he is very nice and the class is pretty easy.  I recomend him for HPS.

Really great guy.  He puts the Powerpoints on WebCT so you are able to look over them, and they're basically what's on the tests.  He is open to questions and is really nice.  Plus we almost always got out early.  I definitely recommend him!
Mr. Hales is a EXCELLENT teacher.  He makes classvery fun and intresting!!  His labs and projects are very easy and his tests are easy as well.  He is very helpful!!!!  Definately take him for HPS!!
